title: India's third 700 MW nuclear power reactor completes hot conditioning, says NPCIL
description: India's third home-built 700 MW nuclear power reactor at Rawatbhata in Rajasthan achieved a significant milestone with the completion of the hot conditioning of its primary heat transport system, according to the Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited (NPCIL). The unit, part of the Rajasthan Atomic Power Project (RAPP) 7&8, is the third reactor in the indigenous 700 MW series.
